newsitem.title: UK: GEC lifted by WSJ report of defence deals.
newsitem.headline: GEC lifted by WSJ report of defence deals.

text.p: Shares in General Electric Co Plc advanced on Monday after the Wall Street Journal Europe newspaper said the British company was looking for foreign defence link-ups.
The shares opened 6-1/2p higher at 369-1/2p at 0830 GMT.
The newspaper said on Monday that GEC was looking at possible deals with French, Italian or German companies after the French government called a halt to the sale of Thomson SA.
GEC was said to have preferred a tie-up between its defence arm GEC-Marconi and Thomson but talks were not possible until France decides how to restructure its industry, the newspaper said.
